Articles.Content:
Hype intensifies, confirmation in 20 minutes !

T-20 minutes

Edited November 12, 2014 by MegaUZI
Very excited!! I like to believe the harpoons are firing right about now.. and that they work!

Although from my understanding the event is actually happening right now.

I had a sudden feeling of relaxation. Let's hope my totally unscientific premonition turns out right and that I did not jinx the whole thing by posting this

In that case: sorry guys, my bad!

I had a sudden feeling of relaxation. Let's hope my totally unscientific premonition turns out right and that I did not jinx the whole thing by posting this

In that case: sorry guys, my bad!

well at least we'll know who to blame!

edit

http://xkcd1446.org/ - at least the whales are calm!

I had a sudden feeling of relaxation. Let's hope my totally unscientific premonition turns out right and that I did not jinx the whole thing by posting this

In that case: sorry guys, my bad!

I think I too have an anecdotal positive sign, maybe a premonition? I just cracked a beer open (it is soon 3am here) while reading this thread with mission control sound in the background Go philae!

Edited November 12, 2014 by merlinux

success!

It looks at last
Landing confirmed!

argh, the live stream cut out, just at the critical moment!! But now reconnected and everyone looks real happy, so.... looks like they did it!

*claps loudly*
the philae manager, told that both harpoons have been sucessfuly fired, and all 3 legs are resting on the comet from telemetry
Landing has been confirmed, the lander is firmly harpooned to the comet with landing gear now retracted and ice screws deployed - now we wait for science to happen!
Great to hear! Heading home now. They better have pictures when I get there...

....ing YES! *Cheers and runs around the lab*

Me and my colleagues have been staring at the feed doing sod all work till confirmation

YES!!!
The ESA is saying that it's a confirmed landing. Time to go try to replicate it in KSP with RemoteTech and kOS.
If Philae is true to ESA tradition, there won't be any pictures before a day or two. ESA is not NASA. They usually suck at PR.

If Philae is true to ESA tradition, there won't be any pictures before a day or two. ESA is not NASA. They usually suck at PR.

That does not jive. Not only did they have awesome animations, they are also presenting this landing very well. First pictures have been announced to be expected about two hours in. They are doing great!

If Philae is true to ESA tradition, there won't be any pictures before a day or two. ESA is not NASA. They usually suck at PR.

We've already had photos of the descent.

If Philae is true to ESA tradition, there won't be any pictures before a day or two. ESA is not NASA. They usually suck at PR.

photos(of the lander on the ground) are expected in about 1.5h This event is very well planned PR wise...

EDIT: I might be wrong and it might be in 30min time. not sure if the time I read somewhere was in GMT or GMT+1

Edited November 12, 2014 by merlinux
The lander has landed yuss
Oh well, no pictures for a couple of hours. Better go and peel some potatoes then. I can pretend I'm taking surface samples from irregular Solar System bodies.
whoooooooooooooohooooo!!

Damn, there was a special event today at the science museum, near where I work, following the whole thing. I might be able to catch the very end of it though.

Anyone in Paris going to la CitÃƒÂ© des Sciences?

Thankyou godess of SPACE!

He he he! \o/

Oh my dear Lord! Thanks for all the engineers hard work and scientist out there!
I know we won't have pictures for a while, but do we know something more than "we've landed on 67P"?
Well, I better sleep. Pictures can wait. Still, congrats to ESA.
Youtube is exploding with comments that the lack of pictures must mean it is a hoax and that people are busy Photoshopping as we speak. We not only learn about comets, but also about human stupidity
